definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :Ho 14:9 cypress or fir (As. burâšu COT:Gloss. Aram. [[בּרוֹתא]], bruwto0, cf. [[בְּרוֹת]] infr., v. also Gr. bra/qu, Lat. bratum, cypress, juniper (PS); in favour of cypress, also LXX SyrVer & so Thes; in favour of fir or pine, Vulgate Rob in RobGes (because cypress not now indigenous on Lebanon); cf. also RS:Proph. iv. n. 20 who lays stress on Ph. n.pr.loc. [[אי בשם]] (= [[איברושים]]) = Gr. Pituou=sai i.e. isle of firs;—v. further Schroed:Phön. Spr. 99 Löw:No. 59 & Brathu as name of Hermon Philo Bybl. in Euseb:Praep. Evang. i. 10)—[[בְּרוֹשׁ]] Ho 14:9 + 4 t.; [[בִּרוֹשִׁים]] 2Sa 6:5 + 11: t., [[בְּרשִׁים]] Na 2:4, [[בְּרוֹשָׁיו]] Is 37:24, [[בְּרשָׁיו]] 2Ki 19:23; —

(lit.) a noble tree, usually ‖[[ארז]] (exc. 2Sa 6:5, 1Ki 6:34, 2Ch 3:5, Ps 104:17, Is 55:13, Ho 14:9, Na 2:4); as standing and growing Is 14:8, Is 37:24 = 2Ki 19:23, Is 41:19, Is 55:13 (‖[[הֲדַס]]) Is 60:13 (‖[[כבוד לבנון]] = [[ארז]]) Ps 104:17.
sim. of luxuriance, stateliness Ez Eze 31:8, productiveness Ho 14:9 (Now thinks cypress), fig. for spear-shafts Na 2:4 Hi-St, but LXX SyrVer [[פרשׁים]]; fig. for mighty men Zec 11:2.

as material (always pl.), for building temple (´[[עחי ב]]) 1Ki 5:22, 1Ki 5:24, 1Ki 6:34 cf. 1Ki 9:11, 2Ch 2:7; ´[[עץ ב]] (sing.) 2Ch 3:5 (cf. Baer's n.); ´[[חלעות ב]] 1Ki 6:15; for ships (no [[עץ]]) Ez Eze 27:5; —[[בְּכׂל עֲחֵי ברושׁים]] 2Sa 6:5 appar. = with all musical instruments made of fir, but ‖ 1Ch 13:8 [[בְּכָל־עׂז וּבְשִׁירִים]] & so here LXX We Dr.
